HeroSection.description: The Caribbean Cybersecurity Agency (ACCYB) is the leading inter-regional player in cybersecurity for the benefit of public and private organizations in French American territories.

majorActivities.title: Our major activities
majorActivities.description1: Consolidate and analyze information representative of the uses and cyber maturity of each territory with a view to adopting strategies adapted to our realities.
majorActivities.description2: Support businesses and communities in an initial cyber maturity assessment process.
majorActivities.description3: Promote awareness and acculturation to the principle of cybersecurity among the general public.
majorActivities.description4: Assistance center for victims of cyberattacks via CSIRT-ATLANTIC.
majorActivities.description5: Monitoring of the internet exposure area of ​​our members' sensitive services.
majorActivities.description6: Broadcast safety alerts reporting immediate danger.

DiscoverTheACCYB.HeroSectionDesciption: Faced with the challenges posed by digital transformation, the Caribbean Agency for Cybersecurity (ACCYB)'s mission is to promote, by all means, knowledge sharing between the scientific, economic, private and public spheres. The agency thus aims to bring about long-term solutions relating to cybersecurity, safety and resilience of the French territories of America and the Caribbean area.

DiscoverTheACCYBOurMission.OurMissionSubDescription1: Organize cyber governance in our territories and promote the regulations in force and share the realities of our territories.
DiscoverTheACCYBOurMission.OurMissionSubDescription2: Identify and analyze the realities of our territories, consolidate shareable data within the community that can enrich reflection.
DiscoverTheACCYBOurMission.OurMissionSubDescription3: Support all stakeholders towards digital trust and promote cybersecurity awareness and training actions.
DiscoverTheACCYBOurMission.OurMissionSubDescription4: Contribute to the strategic thinking of public and private institutions on issues related to cybersecurity and the organization of a trusted local ecosystem, responding to the challenges of our territories.
DiscoverTheACCYBOurMission.OurMissionSubDescription5: Process requests for assistance from mid-sized players and put you in touch with local partners.

DiscoverTheACCYBOurServices.OurServicesActivity3: Raising awareness among members and the general public

DiscoverCSIRT.Description: CSIRT-ATLANTIC is the single cyber assistance center for mid-sized beneficiaries in the French territories of America. It is at the heart of the national system of regional CSIRTs supported by ANSSI, engaged in actions of prevention, protection and sharing of cyber community information.
DiscoverCSIRT.Description3: FROM 9:00 AM TO 12:30 PM - 1:30 PM TO 5:00 PM

DiscoverCSIRT_OurMissions.Title: Our missions
DiscoverCSIRT_OurMissions.description1: Receive, qualify and sort cybersecurity incident reports
DiscoverCSIRT_OurMissions.description2: Connect the beneficiary with local service providers certified and/or qualified by the competent national authorities for handling the security incident.
DiscoverCSIRT_OurMissions.description3: Collaborate within the regional CSIRT community and CERT-FR. Consolidate and share incidentology results with CERT-FR.

DiscovertheObservatory.Title: Discover
DiscovertheObservatory.Description: The Observatory provides public authorities, economic decision-makers and, more generally, the public with regular information
DiscovertheObservatory.DescriptionSpan: on the state and evolution of digital trust, threat, maturity related to cybersecurity.

DiscovertheObservatory_OurMissions.Title: Our missions
DiscovertheObservatory_OurMissions.detail1: Consolidate, using various organizational and technical means, key information useful for understanding our territories.
DiscovertheObservatory_OurMissions.detail2: Study trends and developments in cybersecurity in our territories.
DiscovertheObservatory_OurMissions.detail3: Equip the CSIRT community, economic decision-makers and more generally the greatest number, for decision-making by making studies of our territories available.

JoinACCYB_SecondForm.Title: Membership referent
JoinACCYB_SecondForm.text1: Only the membership representative can exercise the voting rights of the member organization.
JoinACCYB_SecondForm.text2: This membership allows you in particular to represent your organization at general meetings, participate in ACCYB working groups, attend our events, have access to the members directory, be informed of conferences or trade fairs of which the ACCYB is a partner and benefit from preferential rates on certain events and publications.

LegalPage.text1: This personal data protection policy, as well as any document referred to in it, details the conditions under which the Association “Caribbean Agency for Cybersecurity”, ACCYB, located 60 chemin de Reynald, Roujol, in Petit-Bourg , registered in the national directory of associations under number W9G1011279, carries out, as data controller, the processing described below and relating to the personal data of any user of the website – any user of the site being designated below by the term “you”.
LegalPage.text2: We process your personal data in compliance with the principles set by the regulations applicable to the protection of personal data, and in particular Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of April 27, 2016 relating to the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and the free circulation of these personal data, and Law No. 78-17 of January 6, 1978 relating to data processing, files and freedoms, as amended (hereinafter together the “Personal Data Regulations”).
LegalPage.text3: In accordance with the Personal Data Regulations, the term “personal data” means any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person.
LegalPage.text4: This personal data protection policy may be subject to change depending on the applicable legal and regulatory context or the evolution of our activity, and in particular the products or services that we offer you.
LegalPage.title2: 2. THE PRINCIPLES APPLICABLE TO THE PROCESSING OF YOUR PERSONAL DATA
LegalPage.text5: When collecting and processing your personal data, we are committed to respecting the following principles:
LegalPage.list1Detail: your personal data is collected for specific, explicit and legitimate purposes, and on the basis of an appropriate legal basis;
LegalPage.list2Detail: you are informed of each processing operation that we carry out and the characteristics of these processing operations by means of information notices, no processing of your personal data being carried out without your knowledge;
LegalPage.list3Detail: we undertake to only collect and process the personal data concerning you which are strictly necessary for the objective we are pursuing and to update them regularly;
LegalPage.list4Title: Data protection by design and by default :
LegalPage.list4Detail: When developing, designing, configuring and using applications, services and products that rely on the processing of personal data, we take into account your right to the protection of personal data and we we assure our partners that they meet legal requirements and effectively ensure the protection of the personal data that will be processed;
LegalPage.list5Detail: we have implemented technical and organizational measures, adapted according to the degree of sensitivity of the personal data collected, in order to ensure the integrity and confidentiality of your personal data and to protect them against any malicious intrusion, loss, alteration or disclosure to unauthorized third parties. In particular, we use encryption and/or pseudonymization techniques for your personal data whenever possible, useful, or necessary;
LegalPage.text6: The people concerned by the processing that We carry out are:
LegalPage.list2: Customer of a service offered by the ACCYB;
LegalPage.list3: Participant in an event offered by the ACCYB.
LegalPage.text7: We collect personal data about you directly from you when you interact with us such as when you register for an event, browse our sites, report an incident or respond to our surveys.
LegalPage.title3c: 3.3 Purposes of processing, legal bases and storage periods3.3 Purposes of processing, legal bases and storage periods
LegalPage.text8: We implement various processing operations relating to your personal data, the purposes of which are detailed below and the legal bases of which are as follows: your consent or our legitimate interest.
LegalPage.text9: In accordance with the Personal Data Regulations, the personal data that we collect will be used to achieve the purposes for which they were collected and for the period detailed in the table below.
LegalPage.text10: At the end of the retention periods described below, your personal data will be deleted.
LegalPage.title4: 4. YOUR RIGHTS AND THEIR TERMS OF EXERCISE
LegalPage.text11: With regard to your personal data, you benefit from a right of access, rectification, erasure, opposition, limitation of processing, portability of your personal data and the right to give instructions relating to the what happens to your personal data after your death.
LegalPage.text12: You can also withdraw your consent at any time, in cases where it has been requested.
LegalPage.list6Detail1: You can request access to your personal data that we collect and process.
LegalPage.list6Detail2: If you make a request for access, we will provide you with a copy of your personal data in our possession as well as all legally required information.
LegalPage.list7Detail1: You may object at any time, for reasons relating to your particular situation, to the processing of your personal data when it is based on our legitimate interest, unless our legitimate interest overrides your own interests and your rights and freedoms, or that the processing is necessary for the establishment, exercise or defense of legal rights.
LegalPage.list7Detail2: You can also, at any time, object to the processing of your personal data by us when this processing is carried out for commercial prospecting purposes by electronic or postal means.
LegalPage.list8Detail: You can at any time ask us to rectify any personal data concerning you that is inaccurate or incomplete.
LegalPage.list9Detail: You may request the erasure of your personal data under the conditions provided for by the Personal Data Regulations, unless they must be retained to enable us to comply with legal obligations, or to enable us to exercise or defend our rights or again, when they are necessary for the execution of the contract which binds us.
LegalPage.list10Detail: You can request the limitation of the processing of your personal data under the conditions provided for by the Personal Data Regulations.
LegalPage.lis11Detail: You have the right to portability of the personal data that you have provided to us and that we process by automated means, when the processing that we carry out is based on your consent or on the execution of a contract or pre-contractual measures. , provided that the exercise of this right does not infringe the rights and freedoms of third parties.
LegalPage.lis12Detail: Right to define directives relating to the fate of your data after your death You have the possibility of defining general or specific directives concerning the manner in which you intend the rights guaranteed to you by the applicable regulations to be exercised, after your death.
LegalPage.text13: The general guidelines concern all personal data concerning you, and you can revoke them at any time. They can be registered with a trusted digital third party certified by the Commission Nationale de l’Informatique et des Libertés.
LegalPage.text14: The specific directives concern the processing mentioned by these directives and are registered with Us: they are subject to specific consent on your part and you can revoke them at any time.
LegalPage.text15: To exercise your rights, you can:
LegalPage.list13: Send us an email or postal mail to the addresses below, specifying the right you wish to exercise, your personal data concerned by your request and indicating your first and last name and proof of your identity:
LegalPage.list15: Postal mail: “Caribbean Cybersecurity Agency - Right to Personal Data, 60 chemin de Reynald, Roujol, 97170 Petit-Bourg.
LegalPage.text16: If you consider, after having contacted us in this regard, that your rights relating to your personal data are not respected, you can send a complaint to the Commission Nationale de l'Informatique et des Libertés (3 place de Fontenoy - TSA 80715 – 75334 Paris cedex 07 - telephone: 01 53 73 22 22)
